item.title: Didi add a quote by Julia Quinn
item.description: "No one knows as well as I how much nonsense is printed in books." -- Julia Quinn

item.title: Didi add a quote by Karen Marie Moning
item.description: "The most confused we ever get is when we're trying to convince our heads of something our heart knows is a lie." -- Karen Marie Moning

item.title: Didi add a quote by Lauren Willig
item.description: "Patience is only a virtue when there is something worth waiting for." -- Lauren Willig

item.title: Didi add a quote by Erich Segal
item.description: "Love means never having to say you're sorry." -- Erich Segal

item.title: Didi add a quote by Erich Segal
item.description: "True love comes quietly, without banners or flashing lights. If you hear bells, get your ears checked." -- Erich Segal

item.title: Didi add a quote by Matt Dunn
item.description: "When someone loves you, there's nothing they won't do for you. When they stop loving you, there's nothing they will." -- Matt Dunn

item.title: Didi add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Things need not have happened to be true. Tales and dreams are the shadow-truths that will endure when mere facts are dust and ashes, and forgot." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Didi add a quote by Jimi Hendrix
item.description: "I'm the one that's got to die when it's time for me to die, so let me live my life the way I want to." -- Jimi Hendrix

item.title: Didi add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "When the heart speaks, the mind finds it indecent to object." -- Milan Kundera

item.title: Didi add a quote by Jules Verne
item.description: "We are of opinion that instead of letting books grow moldy behind an iron grating, far from the vulgar gaze, it is better to let them wear out by being read." -- Jules Verne

item.title: Didi add a quote by Edna St. Vincent Millay
item.description: "My heart is warm with the friends I make, And better friends I'll not be knowing, Yet there isn't a train I wouldn't take, No matter where it's going." -- Edna St. Vincent Millay

item.title: Didi add a quote by Chaim Potok
item.description: "I've begun to realize that you can listen to silence and learn from it. It has a quality and a dimension all its own." -- Chaim Potok

item.title: Didi add a quote by Nick Hornby
item.description: "Please stop patronizing those who are reading a book - The Da Vinci Code, maybe- because they are enjoying it. For a start, none of us know what kind of an effort this represents for the individual reader. It could be his or her first full-length adult novel; it might be the book that finally reveals the purpose and joy of reading to someone who has hitherto been mystified by the attraction books exert on others. And anyway, reading for enjoyment is what we should all be doing. I don't mean we should all be reading chick lit or thrillers (although if that's what you want to read, it's fine by me, because here's something no one else will tell you: if you don't read the classics, or the novel that won this year's Booker Prize, then nothing bad will happen to you; more importantly,nothing good will happen to you if you do); I simply mean that turning pages should not be like walking through thick mud. The whole purpose of books is that we read them, and if you find you can't, it might not be your inadequacy that's to blame. "Good" books can be pretty awful sometimes." -- Nick Hornby

item.title: Didi add a quote by William Styron
item.description: "A great book should leave you with many experiences, and slightly exhausted at the end. You live several lives while reading." -- William Styron

item.title: Didi add a quote by Vaughn R. Demont
item.description: "...clearly, we're supposed to be together. If this were the internet, seventeen-year-old girls would be writing slash fiction about us as we speak." -- Vaughn R. Demont

item.title: Didi add a quote by Honore de Balzac
item.description: "Reading brings us unknown friends" -- Honore de Balzac
